21-4.name: Coulomb law, describing the electric force between 2 charged particles, where epsilon_0 is approximately 8.85e-12 F/m.

variables.F: Magnitude of the electrostatic force between two point charges
variables.epsilon_0: Permittivity of free space, approximately 8.85 * 10^-12 F/m (farads per meter)

21-4-2.name: Coulomb law with electrostatic constant, describing the electric force between 2 charged particles.

variables.F: Magnitude of the electrostatic force between two point charges

21-0.name: The conversion of electrostatic constant k and permittivity constant epsilon_0, where epsilon_0 is approximately 8.85e-12 F/m and k is 8.99e9N*m^2/C^2

22-1.name: Definition of electric field, defined in terms of the electrostatic force that would be extracted on a positive charge q0

variables.F: Electrostatic force vector experienced by the test charge
variables.q0: Magnitude of the positive test charge placed at the point

22-3.name: Magnitude of the electric field set up by a point charge q at a distance r from the charge, where epsilon_0 is approximately 8.85e-12 F/m

variables.E: Electric field created by the point charge
variables.epsilon_0: Permittivity of free space, approximately 8.85 * 10^-12 F/m (farads per meter)
variables.r: Distance from the charge where the field is being calculated

22-9.name: Magnitude of the electric Field set up by the dipole at a distant point on the dipole axis, where epsilon_0 is approximately 8.85e-12 F/m

variables.E: Electric field due to the dipole

variables.z: Distance between the point and the center of the dipole

22-26.name: Magnitude of the electric at a point on the central axis through a uniformly charged disk, where epsilon_0 is approximately 8.85e-12 F/m

variables.E: Electric field at a point along the axis
variables.s: Surface charge density of the disk
variables.epsilon_0: Permittivity of free space, approximately 8.85 * 10^-12 F/m (farads per meter)
variables.z: Distance along the axis from the center of the disk

22-28.name: Electrostatic force that acts on the point charge, when a point charge q is placed in an external electric field E

23-12.name: Electric field at any point due to an infinite line of charge with uniform linear charge density l, where r is the perpendicular distance from the line to the point, where epsilon_0 is approximately 8.85e-12 F/m

variables.epsilon_0: Permittivity of free space, approximately 8.85 * 10^-12 F/m (farads per meter)
variables.r: Perpendicular distance from the line of charge to the point

variables.epsilon_0: Permittivity of free space, approximately 8.85 * 10^-12 F/m (farads per meter)

23-15.name: Electric field outside a spherical shell of charge with radius R and total charge q, where epsolon_0 is approximately 8.85e-12 F/m

variables.E: Electric field outside the spherical shell
